summary: This document is an email chain from March 2016, forwarded in 2019, discussing a meeting request to discuss a potential sex trafficking case against Jeffrey Epstein. The initial email describes a pitch from lawyers representing a victim and outlines the complex legal background, including Epstein's 2007 non-prosecution agreement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as a financier with multiple homes, accused of sex trafficking with dozens of victims, and subject of a 2007 non-prosecution agreement with the Southern District of Florida USAO.

persons.name: Pete Skinner
persons.context: One of the lawyers who came in earlier in the week to pitch a sex trafficking case against Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Skinner, as a lawyer, pitched a sex trafficking case against Epstein on behalf of a victim.

events.title: Epstein's non-prosecution agreement
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein entered into a non-prosecution agreement with the Southern District of Florida U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Meeting request regarding Epstein case
events.description: An email was sent proposing a meeting to discuss a potential sex trafficking case against Jeffrey Epstein, based on a pitch from lawyers earlier that week.

keyFacts: Lawyers, including Pete Skinner, pitched a sex trafficking case against Jeffrey Epstein to the U.S. Attorney's Office in March 2016.
The case involved a victim who claims to have been prostituted by Epstein when she was 16 years old.
Epstein was described as having 'dozens of victims' and it was unclear if his criminal conduct had stopped.
The email notes Epstein's 2007 non-prosecution agreement with the Southern District of Florida USAO as a complicating factor.
The email chain was forwarded in February 2019, indicating ongoing relevance or review of the matter.
